review_title: A good company and have great benefits well as pay

pros: Small community hospital, easy to park and get to, wide range of acuity of patients
cons: Very few resources, especially on weekends and evenings, lots of staff turnover, few full-time staff with more travelers.

pros: Great supervisors and colleagues that are great—are awesome and supportive with each other’s work completion. A sense of team.
cons: Understaffed for graveyard shift with multiple responsibilities which is almost impossible to complete in the timely manner Depended on the flow of the work at night. Employee turn around.
Short staffed, poor management, bad work flow, assignments often aren’t even, some drama between staff, not a lot of resources or supplies. When you complain people just say “that’s alameda for you”

pros: Working here is generally pretty nice: there's a friendly atmosphere with co-workers that have worked here for 20+ years, decent availability for cross training in other job responsibilities, and visible appreciation from the management. The biggest pro for a non-unioned worker is the really decent health/dental/pto/sick benefits.
cons: The biggest con is the struggle with budget - people work here for 5+ years with no raise and you can't expect one. Not good if you are looking to forward your career. Also almost every department is understaffed, making the "customer service" side of things a little lacking.

review_title: Small town hospital trying to stay relevant
pros: Friendly staff, some nice new facilities (wound care, ortho), subsidized cafeteria
cons: Financial problems, poor senior management, archaic systems

review_title: very nice people and good place to gain experience
pros: good teaching and learning experience, nice staff
cons: low salary compared to area rates

job_title: Director of Nursing in Alameda, CA
pros: The staff are friendly, many have been there for years.
cons: Buildings are dated, funds are tight.
